titleStmt.title: John Williams et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4565

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
We the undesigned citizens of Harison County being to a considerable extent acquainted with the case of Garrett Whetson now in the Jail of this county and condemed to be hanged on the ninth of February next for the murder of a man by the name of Speckard, would respectfully state that we think him a fit subject for the Executive clemency. We therefore ask your Excellency to pardon him
Jan 1864

John Williams
B. F. Dunn
L S Humble
Covington Coleman
Robert Coleman
James Sims
Richard
James Ch
E. Faulconer Sr
T. Crosthwait
R. N. Faulconer
T. S. Faulconer
J. W. Steward

William Bryant
Sanford Faulconer
Jesse Bean

Joshua Swinford

James C, Whetson

John Swinford
Willis T. Whitson
